BiblioData.Title: BLOCK FUNCTIONALIZATION METHODS
BiblioData.Abstract: Epoxy resins are chemically attached to carbon nanotubes (CNTs), in a one-step process in which a reaction mixture comprising the epoxy polymer, the CNTs and a bridging agent which is a chemical compound capable of forming living polymers, e.g. styrene or MMA is formed and radical formation is initiated in the reaction mixture; the epoxy polymer or monomer grafts onto the CNTs through the intermediary block of the bridging agent.

Claims.P: WHAT IS CLAIMED IS:

1 A process of chemically attaching epoxy resin monomer or polymer to carbon nanotubes (CNTs) and adjusting the solubility and plasticity in one-step, which comprises: forming a reaction mixture comprising the epoxy polymer or monomer, the CNTs and a bridging agent which is a chemical compound capable of forming living polymers; and initiating radical formation in the reaction mixture; whereby the epoxy polymer or monomer grafts onto the CNTs through the intermediary block of the bridging agent.
2. The process of claim 1 wherein the polymer or monomer is an epoxy resin.
3. The process of claim 1 or claim 2 wherein initiation is induced radically, thermally, cationically or photolytically.
4. The process of any preceding claim wherein the bridging agent is an olefin, an olefin derivative, a lactone or a lactam.
5. The process of claim 4 wherein the bridging agent is styrene.
6. The process of claim 4 wherein the bridging agent is methyl methacrylate.

7. The process of any of claims 2 - 6 wherein from 1 to 10,000 units of bridging agent are interspersed between the CNT and the epoxy monomer or polymer, by controlling the concentration ratio of bridging agent to epoxy resin.
8. The process of claim 7 wherein from 100 to 2000 units of bridging agent are so interspersed
9. The process of any preceding claim which is conducted in solution in an inert solvent.
10. A functionalized carbon nanotube composite corresponding to the general formula:

CNT - [Block l]-[Block 2] wherein CNT represents the carbon nanotube, "Block 1" represents at least 1 monomelic unit derived from an olefin, olefin derivative, lactone or lactam bridging agent, and "Block 2" represents an epoxy resin.
11. The functionalized carbon nanotube composite of claim 10 wherein "Block 1" has from 1 to 10,000 monomelic units.
12. The functionalized carbon nanotube composite of claim 10 wherein
"Block 1" has from 10 to 2,000 monomelic units.
13. The functionalized carbon nanotube composite of claim 10, claim 11 or claim 12 wherein "Block 1" comprises polymerized styrene units.
14. The functionalized carbon nanotube composite of claim 10, claim 11 or claim 12 wherein "Block 1" comprises polymerized methyl methacrylate units.

15. The functionalized carbon nanotube composite of any of claims 10 - 14 wherein CNT is a single walled carbon nanotube. AMENDED CLAIMS received by the International Bureau on 30 July 2008 (30.07.08)
